intro: Euphrasia aranica, commonly known as the Irish eye or the fairy flower, is a species of flowering plant in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe, particularly Ireland and the British Isles. The plant is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and rocky outcrops. Euphrasia aranica is often found in association with other woodland flora and is a member of the genus Euphrasia, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their intricate floral structures.
